page.title: 02EDGEFIELD GREEN & STREET
page.content: Edgefield is a village which has spread over a considerable area. There is a concentration of housing round the village green and on both sides of the road between Holt and Saxthorpe, and another grouping about a mile away at The Street, sometimes called Ramsgate Street (an indication of the early importance of sheepfarming). The history of the village reveals rivalries between the two areas and there seems to have been great social disparity. Even now, when cottages have been restored and put together to make larger homes, it is clear that some at The Street must have been very tiny. The church was moved nearer to the population about 100 years ago,but it is still on the edge of the community, accessible to both Green and Street. The shop and the pub are both in Edgefield Green.
